meaningMnemonic: A miner works with such <kanji>sincerity</kanji> that her arms and legs start turning <kanji>rust colored</kanji> from <vocabulary>working earnestly</vocabulary>. All the clay and rocks she's putting her <vocabulary>effort</vocabulary> into digging are turning her the same color. That color is how you know someone works with serious <vocabulary>diligence</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
